definitions: To begin to do something new, especially as a hobby or interest.
To accept an offer or a challenge.
To discuss or deal with something.
To shorten a piece of clothing.
examples: She decided to take up painting.
He took up the offer of a new job.
I'll take this matter up with my manager.
The new sofa takes up too much room.
My tailor needs to take up the hem of these pants.
pastTenses: took something up, taken something up
